page.title: 09HOUSING IN SOUTH LEEDS
page.content: The area grew in size as Leeds became an important industrial city. As a result of this the whole area is mainly Victorian, Edwardian and Pre_ war housing. There is a lot of back to back housing and terraced through housing in the area, quite a lot of which has been, or is in the process of being modernised. There is also a lot of council housing in the Belle Isle area which is mainly semi-detatched. These houses were built in the 1930's as a result of the Rt. Rev.Jenkinson,leader of the ruling Labour Council, who wanted to rehouse families from the inner city slums. Before Beeston, Cross Flatts and Hunslet were swallowed up by Leeds they were small villages and in fact Beeston was mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086.
